Dear Oak Park Community,

Find ebooks and digital resources below curated by our librarians as we proclaim that Black Lives Matter.

In solidarity and with humility,

David J. Seleb

post_text: Be counted, Oak Park! Complete your 2020 U.S. Census form today.
shared_text:
OAK-PARK.US
Oak Parkers urged to make a difference by participating in coming Census

Village of Oak Park, Illinois
April 12 at 11:25 AM ¬∑

The US Census Bureau is tracking the 2020 Census response rate for every community in the country. Oak Park has a response rate of 55.6 percent as of April 10. That's slightly higher than the state average (52 percent) and national average (47.5 percent), but there is still along way to go to making sure our community is accurately counted. If you have not already, please take a few minutes and fill out your 2020 Census form online, via email or by telephone. Why is this so important? The once-a-decade count will help lawmakers, business owners and many others make critical decisions over the next 10 years. The data also helps determine how to allocate funds for services that help families, older adults and children, which will be critical as Oak Park and the country recover from the coronavirus pandemic.

Respond online: www.2020census.gov
Track response rates: www.2020census.gov/en/response-rates
Oak Park Census info: www.oak-park.us/2020census

Seize the day, and come see the #oprfhs Winter Musical, "Newsies!"

This new Disney musical is based on the real-life New York Newsboys Strike of 1899. The story focuses on Jack Kelly, a rebellious newsboy who dreams of a life away from the bustle of the big city. After publishing giant Joseph Pulitzer raises the price of papers at the cost of the newsboys, Kelly rallies his fellow newsies into action. They challenge the establishment, and all of New York has to recognize the power of the "little people." With music by Alan Menken, lyrics by Jack Feldman, and book by Harvey Fierstein, this production promises to wow audiences!

Tickets are available here: https://oprfhs.ticketleap.com/disneys-newsies/

World Language teachers presented at the National American Council for Teachers of Foreign Language (ACTFL) conference last month.

Betsy Farley and Jessica Howell presented "A Tale of Two Teachers: Building Proficiency Through collaboration." The presentation walked the audience through what proficiency looks like on a day-to-day basis. They also described their process of creating interesting and culturally relevant thematic units using contemporary topics such as the television series "Stranger Things" to foster student engagement and promote proficiency.

Gisele Ramilo presented "Nama-stay in the Moment: Mindfulness in the World Language Classroom." This presentation modeled mindfulness activities that can be conducted in the target language to lower the affective filter and establish a positive culture of language learning.

Kudos to our Huskie educators! #oprfhs

District 200 to vote against arming staff members in Illinois schools:

At the annual meeting of the Illinois Association of School Boards (IASB) on Nov. 23, District 200 Board delegate Gina Harris will vote on behalf of the Board against a resolution that would give local school districts the option of allowing trained staff members to carry firearms at school.

The D200 Board discussed the IASB resolution at its October regular meeting. Members expressed a variety of reasons why any resolution that would allow a school district in Illinois to have the option to arm staff was contrary to the values of our community and school district. These included an increased risk of fatalities in schools where weapons are permitted, the susceptibility of even well trained personnel to make poor judgments under stress, and the fact that OPRF students visit other schools for matches and events. Ms. Harris summarized the discussion by saying, ‚ÄúHaving a gun in a building where there are students is a big no.‚Äù
